events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on May 30th involving rear-end damage to their car.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident based on keywords in the report.
An insurance agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the customer's case.
Acknowledgement of the accident claim was sent to the customer, confirming receipt of the report.
Customer was asked to provide photos of the damaged vehicle and police accident report documents.
Customer submitted requested documents including pictures of the car damage and official police report.
Investigation began to verify details of the accident and assess the extent of vehicle damage.
Investigation team completed inspection and confirmed the incident matches the customer’s account.
A settlement amount was proposed to cover the repair costs of the vehicle following the accident.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the process.
Claim was formally approved by the insurance adjuster after considering all submitted evidence.
Insurance payment was processed and sent to the customer’s bank account for vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim was closed following receipt of payment and confirmation of customer satisfaction.
